intro: Verbascum serratifolium, commonly known as the serrated leaf mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and tall spikes of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for respiratory ailments. Verbascum serratifolium is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
